definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Their advantage is that virtually every business already has a word processing tool.
sentences.chinese: 其优势在于，几乎每个公司都已经有了文字处理工具。

sentences.english: If you want to do word processing on it, good luck.
sentences.chinese: 假如你想用它做文字处理，也祝你好运。

sentences.english: Yes, I know most of the word processing. presentation, spreadsheet program.
sentences.chinese: 我知道大部分文字处理，简报，试算表程序。

sentences.english: To capture the details you to use them along with a word processing tool.
sentences.chinese: 为了捕获细节，需要将其与文字处理工具配合使用。

sentences.english: Enter your new document into the word-processing system.
sentences.chinese: 把你的新文件输入文字处理系统。

sentences.english: It does word processing, spreadsheets, slideshows.
sentences.chinese: 它可以用来做文字处理，排版，幻灯片。

sentences.english: But I don't have enough word-processing skills.
sentences.chinese: 但是我没有足够的文字处理技术。

sentences.english: Your computer works only as a word-processor.
sentences.chinese: 你的电脑只起到了文字处理的作用。

definition: my (Internet slang variant of 我的[wo3 de5])
